page.title: 13Traffic through Willingham
page.content: The village of{Willingham}has developed around a cross-roads about 10 miles north of Cambridge and 2 miles south of a river crossing at Earith. Its strategic position means that, at peak times, there is a considerable traffic flow in all four directions. The{speed limit}inside the village boundaries is 40 m.p.h. falling to 30 m.p.h. in the centre of the village. In the peak traffic periods, from 8.00 to 9.00 hrs. and 17.00 to 18.00 hrs., more than{250 vehicles per hour}pass through the cross roads. These are mainly{private cars.}Lorries, some carrying local produce, form the next highest category. The main flow tends to be towards{Cambridge}in the morning and the reverse in the evening, indicating the significant employment factor of the proximity of the city.
